required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Regulation of Metabolism and Ion Handling
clinical_study.official_title: Regulation of Metabolism and Ion Handling - Effect of High Intensity Training and NAC-infusion in Young Men

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigates the relation between ion-handling (K+) and fatigue development during exercise. Before and after a 6-week period of high intensity interval training, performance and ion-handling is assessed in young adults. In addition, mitochondrial function is examined.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from before (baseline) to after 6 weeks of training (Week 6)
primary_outcome.description: Time to exhaustion during knee-extensor exercise

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from before (baseline) to after 6 weeks of training (Week 6)
secondary_outcome.description: Net leg K+ release in mmol/min during knee-extensor exercise

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from before (baseline) to after 6 weeks of training (Week 6)
other_outcome.description: Femoral venous plasma K+ in mmol/L during knee-extensor exercise

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from before (baseline) to after 6 weeks of training (Week 6)
other_outcome.description: Femoral venous lactate in mmol/L during knee-extensor exercise

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from before (baseline) to after 6 weeks of training (Week 6)
other_outcome.description: Muscle Na+/K+-ATPase subunit content from vastus lateralis biopsies

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from before (baseline) to after 6 weeks of training (Week 6)
other_outcome.description: Muscle mitochondrial respiration by high resolution respirometry (flux per mg muscle) from vastus lateralis biopsies

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from before (baseline) to after 6 weeks of training (Week 6)
other_outcome.description: Muscle mitochondrial content of citrate synthase from vastus lateralis biopsies

arm_group.description: Asked to continue their usual life style

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy men
- 45-55 ml/kg/min
- BMI 19-26 kg/m2
- Normal ECG (assessed by MD)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergic to n-acetylcystine (NAC) or digoxin
- Severe side effects from NAC or digoxin
- Chronic diseases (assessed by MD to be a potential hazard or to interfere with outcome measures)
